data.event: Clark County was formed in 1819 out of Crawford County.

event.title: 1821 the northern part of Clark County became

data.event: In 1821 the northern part of Clark County became part of the newly created Pike County on January 31, and the newly created Fayette County took the western part of Clark County on February 14.

event.title: January 31, and the newly created Fayette County took

data.event: In 1821 the northern part of Clark County became part of the newly created Pike County on January 31, and the newly created Fayette County took the western part of Clark County on February 14.

event.title: was created from the northern part of Clark County on January 3, 1823

data.event: Edgar County was created from the northern part of Clark County on January 3, 1823.

event.title: occupied additional land from western Clark County, effective December 25, 1830

data.event: The creation of Coles County occupied additional land from western Clark County, effective December 25, 1830.
